column4: is there a way to remove flash by itself, or is it embedded in firefox?
if I want to use synaptic to remove firefox, why the hell does it want to take all of gnome with it?
what do you mean 'all of gnome'?
you know how it lists other stuff to remove?  In that list is gnome, gnome-desktop-environment, etc
that might be a meta package like ubuntu-desktop
anyway around it?  I want to install firefox from source, hoping to fix my flash issue...
flash maxes out my CPU when it's running.... such as watching videos on youtube
are you running flash 9? I don't seem to have this problem.
I have no idea what I'm running.  The reason I wanted to uninstall firefox is that I can't find any standalone installation of flash anywhere... I think it's just embedded into firefox
not installed in synaptic, and not as a plugin in firefox that I could find
have you read the wiki yet?
I couldn't find any relevant entries
are you referring to the flashplugin-nonfree package?
it was never installed.  I'm trying to get rid of flash, not add another one.  Plus, I tried installing that package for kicks to see if it would do anything, but it didn't help a bit.
follow the instructions on that site.
